title: Expected error in period of pendulum

content.prompt: The period T of a pendulum of length L is measured to determine g at the surface of Earth. The equation used is  T=2π L/g MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D16@ . The mass of the pendulum bob is 10.0 kg, and the length of the pendulum is 1.00 m. Which of the following would contribute most to the expected error in the result?

choices.label: A 10% uncertainty in the measurement of the mass
Variation in the value of g as the pendulum bob moves along its arc
Using the average period of 10 timed oscillations instead of the period of 1 timed oscillation
Starting the pendulum swinging by releasing it from a horizontal position

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
